full_text: Fer Lat et, El i 2015/KER/17456 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT BERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE ANIL K.NARENDRAN TUESDAY, THE 28TH DAY OF APRIL 2015/8TH VAISAKHA, 1937 Cr1.MC.No. 2608 of 2015 () cc 439/2014 of J.M.F.C., ETTUMANUR CRIME NO. 401/2011 OF ETTUMANOOR POLICE STATION PETITIONER (S)/ACCUSED :- ROY VARGHESE, AGED 48 YEARS S/O.VARGHESE, KACHAPPILLY HOUSE, KEZHMADU ALUVA. BY ADV. SRI.K.S.RAJEEV (ALUVA) RESPONDENT (S) /COMPLAINANT :- STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682 031. BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI.ABHIJITT LESSLI THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASK HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 28-04-2015, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: jvt ope 2015/KER/17456 ANIL K. NARENDRAN, J. CrL.M.C. No.2608 of 2015 Dated this the 28" day of April 2015 ORDER Petitioner is arrayed as the first accused in Crime No.401/2011 of Ettumanoor Police Station, which is pending as C.C.No.439 of 2014 on the file of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Ettumanoor, registered for the offence punishable under Section 420 r/w 34 of IPC. The grievance of the petitioner is that, the Magistrate Court has already issued non-bailable warrant against him and if he surrenders before the Magistrate Court there is likelihood of the application not being considered on the very same day. Hence, he has filed this Crl.M.C. seeking an order directing the Magistrate Court to consider and pass appropriate orders on his bail application on the day of surrender itself. 2. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioner and the learned Public Prosecutor for respondent. 3. Considering the facts and circumstances of the case, this Crl.M.C. is disposed of directing the petitioner to surrender before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Ettumanoor BEST a eae 2015/KER/17456 Crl.M.C. No.2608 of 2015 -20- within two weeks from today and the Magistrate Court is further directed to consider and pass appropriate orders on the bail application filed by the petitioner on the same day itself, in accordance with law. The non-bailable warrant issued against the petitioner shall be kept in abeyance for a period of two weeks from today. This Crl.M.C. is disposed of. Sd/- ANIL K. NARENDRAN JUDGE /[TRUE COPY// P.A. TO JUDGE jvt
